data.title: 66 Locations in Minnesota Now Have the Best Burger in the Entire Country
data.meta_description: Did you know there are now 66 locations across the Land of 10,000 Lakes where you can dig into the hamburger that's been named America's favorite?
data.text:
Did you know there are now 66 locations across the Land of 10,000 Lakes where you can dig into the hamburger that's been named America's favorite?

To say hamburgers are one of our favorite foods here in the North Star State and across the country might be a bit of an understatement. A good burger might be our FAVORITE food overall. Because here in the U.S. we eat a LOT of them!

Yahoo News reports that Americans consume over 50 billion hamburgers every year. (Yes, that's a billion, with a 'b'!) If you do the math on that number, it means, on average, Americans will eat 2.4 burgers every day. And we've loved burgers for a fairly long time, too. Yahoo says the first burger was sold back in 1904 at the St. Louis Louisiana Purchase Exposition.

ALSO INTERESTING: Restaurant Chain Founded in Minnesota Just Filed For Bankruptcy

There are, of course, a lot places that will sell you a burger these days. But only one of them has been called America's Favorite Burger-- and there are 66 places you can get your hands on one here in the North Star State.

So which burger IS America's Favorite? According to Eat This Not That!, that title goes to Culver's-- which was founded across the Cheddar Curtain over in Sauk City, Wisconsin. According to their survey, Culver's scored highest among America's burger chains in terms of customer satisfaction, allowing them to walk away with the title of America's Best Burger.

Specifically, Eat This Not That! said Culver's placed first in their survey for several reasons:

Culver's wowed the guests who dined at its 882 locations, averaging an impressive score of 4.34 out of 5. To put it in perspective, Sonic Drive-In came in second with a much lower 3.69 average rating.

As we mentioned, Culver's was founded over in America's Dairyland and just celebrated its 40th anniversary earlier this summer. The very first Culver's opened back in 1984, and has expanded to 146 stores there. Across the Midwest, you can also find Culvers in Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Michigan, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota, Ohio, and South Dakota.

Here in our neck of the woods, Minnesota currently operates 66 Culver's locations, including the following cities (though some have several Culver's locations):

Baxter

St. Cloud

Waite Park

Alexandria

Grand Rapids

Monticello

Elk River

Albertville

Buffalo

Rogers

Cambridge

Anoka

Maple Grove

Hutchinson

Delano

Bemidji

Coon Rapids

Plymouth

Champlin

Blaine

Brooklyn Center

Wilmar

Golden Valley

St. Anthony

Little Canada

Minnetonka

Vadnais Heights

Duluth

Waconia

Eden Prairie

Wayzata

St. Paul

White Bear Lake

Chanhassen

Forest Lake

Chaska

Bloomington

Shakopee

West St. Paul

Savage

Stillwater

Woodbury

Cottage Grove

Eagan

Lakeville

Apple Valley

Rosemount

Two Harbors

Hastings

Northfield

North Mankato

Red Wing

Marshall

Owatonna

Rochester

Austin

Winona

Behind Culver's and Sonic, Mooyah, Five Guys, and Fuddruckers rounded out the top five in the Eat This Not That! America's Best Burger survey. And while some of those chains might be a bit unfamiliar, keep scrolling to check out the most popular and well-known brands in the U.S.

Listen to Curt St. John & Samm Adams

weekdays from 6 to 10 a.m. on Quick Country 96.5
